title: Wendy Williams snaps at audience member to 'get out' after their phone rang
text:
Wendy Williams was seen snapping at an audience member of her show on Tuesday after she heard their phone ring.

The 55-year-old talk-show host was in the middle of her Hot Topics segment when she was interrupted and subsequently scolded the person.

'Is somebody's phone on?' she asked the audience, to which many people replied, 'Yes.'

'Get out': Wendy Williams was not here to play on Tuesday when she scolded an audience member and asked them to 'get out' when their phone rang in the middle of her Hot Topics segment

'Get out. Get out. Turn that phone off now, sir, ma'am, whoever you are,' she insisted.

Wendy seemingly realized in retrospect she may have come across a little to harsh so she further elaborated of her annoyance in a softer way.

'The tickets are kindly free but when you come here you must turn your phones off,' she said.

Served by Wendy! 'Get out. Get out. Turn that phone off now, sir, ma'am, whoever you are'

Big news! And that wasn't the only big thing the come out of Tuesday's Wendy Williams Show, with the personality revealing she's getting her star on The Hollywood Walk of Fame come Thursday week

She continued: 'I was being over-dramatic but kindly please turn your phone off. Thank you.'

And that wasn't the only big thing to come out of Tuesday's Wendy Williams Show, with the personality revealing she's getting her star on The Hollywood Walk Of Fame.

'I can't breathe, I can't tell you, I can't breathe,' she began extremely excitedly.

Wendy went on to tease that she had asked her stylists to find her a 'poofy and plunging' dress for the incredibly special ceremony.

'It will be the 2677th star. I'll be getting my star in a good neighborhood,' she exclaimed, adding she didn't want to be with the 'dead' forgotten people that weren't in the highlighted tourist part of the strip.

They said yes! 'I reached out on a wing and a prayer and I'm glad they both said yes,' she began. 'I got the CEO of FOX TV Station, Jack Abernethy (left). Look, Jack is all our bosses right? So Jack's going to speak for me for the TV and without radio there wasn't TV so I got the king of all radio, Elvis Duran (right)'

Mom and son: And before fans began wondering if Wendy would be bringing a date along, she disclosed it would just be her son, Kevin Hunter Jr., 19

'I'm near Ryan Murphy and Jason Bateman. We know them, we know them!'

Wendy also told her audience that she had to have a big think about the two people she wanted to give speeches and help anoint her during the ceremony.

'I reached out on a wing and a prayer and I'm glad they both said yes,' she began.

'I got the CEO of FOX TV Station, Jack Abernethy. Look, Jack is all our bosses right? So Jack's going to speak for me for the TV and without radio there wasn't TV so I got the king of all radio, Elvis Duran.'

And before fans began wondering if Wendy would be bringing a date along, she disclosed it would just be her son, Kevin Hunter Jr., 19.

'I'm going to be crookin' arms with my son.'

Wendy confirmed she will be receiving her star on October 18 and begged her fans to come along as she really 'wants to feel it.'

Getting a star on the Hollywood Walk Of Fame comes via self submission and a $40,000 fee.

Pricey! Getting a star on the Hollywood Walk Of Fame comes via self submission and a $40,000 fee

Newcomer: Tyler Perry recently received his star (pictured October 1)

The most coveted placement has been in front of the Hollywood Boulevard's Roosevelt Hotel (where where Julio Iglesias, Meryl Streep, Holly Hunter, and Joan Rivers are place) and the Hollywood and Highland shopping center (with Sandra Bullock, Nicole Kidman, Susan Sarandon).

There is one spot left in front of the prestige Chinese Theater and it's being reserved for Clint Eastwood, according to Walk of Fame's Vice President of Media Relations and Producer, Ana Martinez.

'There’s one spot left in front of the Chinese Theater and we’re saving it,' she told Time in 2013.

'He’s been approved, but he never set a date [for the ceremony].'

Clint joins actors such as Denzel Washington, George Clooney, Al Pacino, Bruce Springsteen and Julia Roberts.

The clan have been nominated several times by their team or others but have shown no interest in getting a star.

Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Leonardo DiCaprio, Robert De Niro, Casey Affleck and Emma Stone have never even been nominated, according to a Today article in 2017.
description: Wendy Williams was not here to play on Tuesday when she scolded an audience member and asked them to 'get out' when their phone rang in the middle of her Hot Topics segment.
